Serah Terima Ketua KOI dari Erick ke Okto, Begini Pesannya
04 Nov 2019, 15:13 by Antara, Ariandono
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Komite Olimpiade Indonesia (KOI) melakukan acara serah terima jabatan kepengurusan dari Ketua NOC periode 2015-2019 Erick Thohir kepada Raja Sapta Oktohari, yang terpilih sebagai Ketua KOI periode 2019-2023 di Kantor Pusat KOI, Senayan, Jakarta.
Dalam agenda sertijab tersebut, Erick yang kini menjabat sebagai Menteri BUMN RI menyampaikan selamat dan mengutarakan sejumlah pesan kepada Okto.
"Kepada ketua yang baru saya berpesan untuk bersiap menghadapi event internasional yang sudah ada di depan mata. Kejuaraan dunia basket, Piala Dunia U-21, dan tengah diusahakan juga menjadi tuan rumah World Beach Games," kata Erick saat memberikan sambutan di Jakarta, Senin.
Sementara itu, Okto pun memuji hasil kinerja Erick yang sebelumnya berhasil membawa Indonesia lebih dikenal dunia internasional berkat kesuksesannya menggelar Asian Games 2018 saat memimpin KOI.
"Jadi ketua itu mudah, tapi berbeda ceritanya kalau menggantikan Erick Thohir. Menggantikan Erick itu susah sekali karena harus menjaga dengan baik. Ia mewariskan sesuatu yang tidak ringan, tanggung jawab ke Merah Putih," pungkas Okto.
Dalam kepengurusannya, Okto berkomitmen untuk mengembangkan olahraga nasional agar ke tahap yang lebih baik di kancah internasional, berkoordinasi dengan elemen lain, seperti Kementerian Pemuda dan Olahraga (Kemenpora RI), KONI, cabang-cabang olahraga, hingga Kementerian Pariwisata sekaligus mempromosikan Indonesia melalui olahraga.
Tidak lupa juga ia meminta seluruh pihak untuk menyebut Komite Olahraga Indonesia tidak lagi dengan "KOI" namun menjadi "NOC", mengikuti regulasi nomenklatur internasional.
Selain itu, di kesempatan ini Okto juga meminta Erick untuk menandatangani sebuah plakat peresmian ruangan "function hall" baru Kantor KOI yang terletak di lantai 16 yang baru saja direnovasi.
"Tugas ke depan kami sangat berat, ada tugas besar, yaitu harus semakin berprestasi di kancah internasional, sekaligus mengantarkan atlet-atlet terbaik kita untuk merebut juara dan medali di ajang internasional. Kami optimistis dengan kerja sama yang baik Indonesia akan kembali tampil dan jadi pemenang di ajang yang bergengsi," kata Raja Sapta Oktohari.

Handover of the Chairman of the KOI from Erick to Okto, Here's the Message
Nov 04 2019, 15:13 by Antara, Ariandono
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Indonesian Olympic Committee (KOI) held a handover from the NOC Chairperson for the 2015-2019 period Erick Thohir to Raja Sapta Oktohari, who was elected as KOI Chair for the 2019-2023 period at the KOI Headquarters, Senayan, Jakarta.
In the certijab agenda, Erick who now serves as Minister of BUMN RI congratulated and expressed a number of messages to Okto.
"To the new chairman, I advise you to prepare for the international event that is already in front of you. The basketball world championship, U-21 World Cup, and being tried to host the World Beach Games," Erick said when giving a speech in Jakarta on Monday. .
Meanwhile, Okto also praised the results of Erick's performance which previously succeeded in bringing Indonesia to be better known internationally due to his success in holding the 2018 Asian Games while leading KOI.
"So the chairman is easy, but the story is different if replacing Erick Thohir. Replacing Erick is very difficult because they have to maintain it well. He left something that is not light, responsibility to the Red and White," concluded Okto.
In its management, Okto is committed to developing national sports to a better stage in the international arena, coordinating with other elements, such as the Ministry of Youth and Sports (Kemenpora RI), KONI, sports branches, to the Ministry of Tourism while promoting Indonesia through sports.
He also did not forget to ask all parties to call the Indonesian Sports Committee no longer "KOI" but "NOC", following international nomenclature regulations.
In addition, on this occasion Okto also asked Erick to sign an inauguration plaque for the new "function hall" room at the KOI Office, located on the 16th floor that had just been renovated.
"Our task ahead is very heavy, there is a big task, which must be increasingly accomplished in the international arena, while delivering our best athletes to win champions and medals in international events. We are optimistic that with good cooperation Indonesia will return to appear and be a winner in a prestigious event, "said Raja Sapta Oktohari.
